title: Ambiguity Resolution Practice
goal: Practice resolving tanru ambiguity with `bo` and `ke...ke'e`.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Quick grouping check:

barda blanu gerku (default) = ?
barda blanu bo gerku = ?
barda ke blanu gerku ke'e = ?

(Answers: (barda blanu) gerku, barda (blanu gerku), barda (blanu gerku))

New Material (5-7 min)

Ambiguity in Three-Word Tanru

Consider: clani cinla djine

Default interpretation: (clani cinla) djine

  • (long-thin) ring
  • A ring that is both long and thin

Alternative interpretation: clani (cinla djine)

  • long (thin-ring)
  • A long instance of a thin-ring type

Which do you mean? Use grouping to clarify.

Resolution Strategy

  1. Identify the ambiguity — What are the possible groupings?
  2. Decide your meaning — Which interpretation do you want?
  3. Apply grouping — Use bo or ke...ke'e if needed

Practice Cases

Case 1: sutra bajra gerku

Grouping Meaning How to express
(sutra bajra) gerku fast-running dog sutra bajra gerku (default)
sutra (bajra gerku) fast running-dog sutra bajra bo gerku

Case 2: barda xunre bolci

Grouping Meaning How to express
(barda xunre) bolci big-red ball barda xunre bolci (default)
barda (xunre bolci) big red-ball barda xunre bo bolci

When Default Is Fine

If the default grouping matches your intent, no modification needed.

blanu gerku zdani = (blanu gerku) zdani = blue-dog house (house for blue dogs)

This probably makes sense as-is.

Key Point

Only add bo or ke...ke'e when you need to override the default grouping.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Resolve Ambiguity

For each, give both groupings and how to express each:

  1. cmalu crino mlatu

    • Default meaning: ?
    • Alternative meaning: ?

  2. sutra klama prenu

    • Default meaning: ?
    • Alternative meaning: ?
Answers

  1. Default: (cmalu crino) mlatu — small-green cat Alternative: cmalu (crino mlatu) — small green-cat Express alternative: cmalu crino bo mlatu

  2. Default: (sutra klama) prenu — fast-going person Alternative: sutra (klama prenu) — fast going-person Express alternative: sutra klama bo prenu

Exercise 2: Choose Correct Form

Write the tanru for each meaning:

  1. (thin-black) ring (both thin and black)
  2. thin (black-ring) (a thin instance of black-ring)
  3. (big-blue) cube (both big and blue)
  4. big (blue-cube) (a big instance of blue-cube)
Answers
  1. cinla xekri djine
  2. cinla xekri bo djine
  3. barda blanu kubli
  4. barda blanu bo kubli

Exercise 3: Real-World Descriptions

Translate with appropriate grouping:

  1. A fast (running dog) → running-dog is the type
  2. A (big blue) house → both big and blue
  3. A small (red ball) → red-ball is the type
Answers
  1. sutra bajra bo gerku
  2. barda blanu zdani
  3. cmalu xunre bo bolci

items.text: A fast (running dog) → running-dog is the type
A (big blue) house → both big and blue
A small (red ball) → red-ball is the type

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud, paying attention to grouping:

  1. "(Big-blue) dog" → ti barda blanu gerku
  2. "Big (blue-dog)" → ti barda blanu bo gerku
  3. "This is a thin black ring." → ti cinla xekri djine

Today's Vocab

Review — focus on grouping concepts.

Decision guide:

If you want... Use...
(a b) c Default (no modification)
a (b c) a b bo c or a ke b c ke'e

Summary

You practiced identifying and resolving tanru ambiguity. Use bo or ke...ke'e only when the default grouping doesn't match your intent.

Tomorrow preview: Full week review with all 8 new gismu and comprehensive grouping practice.
